sentence.Network_en: "I'm trying to sleep," he lied, speaking reprovingly.
sentence.Network_cn: “我正想睡觉呢，”他撒了个谎，语气中带着责备。

sentence.Network_en: Norwegian Anna, always dignified, looked at her reprovingly.
sentence.Network_cn: 一向态度威严的挪威人安娜用责备的眼光望望她.

sentence.Network_en: He pointed his forefinger at me reprovingly.
sentence.Network_cn: 他用食指指著我,表示责备的意思.

PerfectNetExp.abs: reprove 责备reprovingly 挑剔地reprovision 再给食品
reprovingly 申斥似地, reprovingly 责难似地, reprovingly 谴责地
reprove 重证, reprovingly 谴责地, reprovingly 申斥似地
reprove 训斥, reprovingly 申斥似地, reprove 重证

list.abs: (6)责问 [ask reprovingly]昭王南征而不复,寡人是问。――《左传·僖公四年》

entry.tran: 表示谴责的;责怪的;责备的
entry.def: If you give someone a reproving look or speak in a reproving voice, you show or say that you think they have behaved in a wrong or foolish way.

example.ex: 'Flatterer,' she said giving him a mock reproving look.
example.tran: “马屁精，”她饱含嘲弄和责备地看了他一眼，说道。

means.word_mean: 1. in a reproving or reproachful manner;

auth_sentence.content: They'll milk her, the man says reprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content: They'll milk her, the man says reprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They'll milk her, the man says reprovingly.
